    • checkNotification

      public java.lang.String checkNotification​(Task task)
      A method to check if a task has a notification checked.
      Parameters:
      task - the task to check.
      Returns:
      On if a notification is checked, Off is no notification is checked.

    • clickFinishTask

      public void clickFinishTask​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws java.io.IOException
      Checks if task is repeatable. Displays confirmation popup for repeatable task if true. Else: Checks for confirmation popup settings. Calls this.finishTask() if true. Displays confirmation popup if false.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • finishTask

      public void finishTask​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws java.io.IOException
      Moves task to 'Finished tasks' folder. Setting finish date. Creates new repeatable task if task is repeatable.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • clickDeleteButton

      public void clickDeleteButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws java.io.IOException
      Checks if task is repeatable. Displays confirmation popup for repeatable task if true. Else: Checks for confirmation popup settings. Calls this.deleteTask() if true. Displays confirmation popup if false.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • deleteTask

      public void deleteTask​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws java.io.IOException
      Moves task to 'Trash bin' folder. or deletes task if it already is in delete folder. Creates new repeatable task if task is repeatable.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • clickRestoreTask

      public void clickRestoreTask() throws java.io.IOException
      calls method restoreTask().
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • restoreTask

      public void restoreTask() throws java.io.IOException
      Restores the task to its previous category (and project if applicable). calls TaskService.editCategoryAndProjectOfTask.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • setTaskIsRepeatable

      public void setTaskIsRepeatable​(boolean value)
      Used to set the tasks repeatable value.
      Parameters:
      value - boolean new value of isRepeatable for this taskId.

    • buttonEditTask

    • setTaskColor

      public void setTaskColor​(java.lang.String backgroundColor)
      Method for adjusting the text color of task UI, according to the background color. Helper methods in ColorUtil are used to determine the outcome.
      Parameters:
      backgroundColor - The background color as HEX

    • addClickTaskListener

      public void addClickTaskListener()
      Method for adding onMouseClicked listener to this tasks background.

    • editTask

      public void editTask() throws java.io.IOException
      methode used for editing a task.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • setHeightOfTaskDescription

      public void setHeightOfTaskDescription()
      In order to get the proper height for the description when we load the maximized view, we recreate the label and put font size and wrapping. Then we set the width of the label in order to simulate what height the label will end up width after wrapping around that width (Background of Task UI is the width). We have to add a listener to the label, in order to execute the code when the height property has been fully set. When that is done we can set the height of our taskDescription label. We delete the sample label since we dont need it anymore.

    • setButtons

      public void setButtons()
      This method set visible and managed properties of task HBox buttons based on the tasks category. Three outcomes: Finished tasks, Trash bin and default(all other categories).
